Material used.Description: In vitro kinase assay was performed using dopaminergic neuronal lines with LRRK2 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: p.G2385R showed higher kinase activity compared to wild type, with significant increase in autokinase activity (p<0.05) and MBP phosphorylation (p<0.001).
p.R1628P showed higher kinase activity compared to wild type, with significant increase in autokinase activity (p=0.07) and MBP phosphorylation (p<0.001).
p.R1398H had significantly lower kinase activity compared to wild type, with reduced autokinase activity and MBP phosphorylation (p<0.001).
p.N551K was not directly tested for kinase activity in the study, but is in linkage disequilibrium with p.R1398H, suggesting a potential protective effect.
p.S1647T showed kinase activity similar to wild type, with no significant difference in autokinase activity or MBP phosphorylation.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed with multiple replicates (n=4) as indicated in the histograms of kinase activities.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control for kinase activity comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: Vector control (pCDNA3 vector) was used as a negative control in kinase assays.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical significance was determined with p-values (e.g., p<0.05, p<0.001) for kinase activity comparisons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity levels comparable to wild-type LRRK2.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity significantly higher or lower than wild-type LRRK2 (p<0.05).
